details: contract to get the network analytics for the staking efficiency use case

AnalyticsReceived(bytes32,uint8,uint256,.details: event emitted when having a response from Chainlink with the SLI

addNetwork(bytes32).details: function to add a valid network name

constructor.details: parameterize the variables according to network

params._chainlinkOracle: 1. the address of the oracle to create requests to
params._chainlinkToken: 2. the address of LINK token contract
params._jobId: 3. the job id for the HTTPGet job
params._periodRegistry: 4. the job id for the HTTPGet job

fulFillAnalytics(bytes32,bytes32).details: callback function for the Chainlink SLI request which stores the SLI in the SLA contract

params._requestId: the ID of the ChainLink request

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestAnalytics(uint256,uint8,bytes32).details: Request analytics object for the current period.

params._periodId: 1. id of the canonical period to be analyzed
params._periodType: 2. type of period to be queried

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

fee.details: fee for Chainlink querys. Currently 0.1 LINK

networkNames.details: bytes32 to store the available network names

periodAnalytics.details: (networkName=>periodType=>periodId=>bytes32) to store ipfsHash of the analytics corresponding to periodId

requestIdToAnalyticsRequest.details: Mapping that stores chainlink analytics request information

title: NetworkAnalytics
